cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles east of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northward just offshore the Florida east coast and then turning north-northeast toward the South Carolina/North Carolina coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: somewhere along the South Carolina or southern North Carolina coast

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast from Jupiter Inlet northward through Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Low (5%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts possible as the wind field brushes South Florida.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation below 2 ft possible; no significant surge threat for PortMiami.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate showers possible, generally below 3 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and high surf along exposed Atlantic beaches.
